title: The Steep Cost of Ron DeSantis’s Vaccine Turnabout
description: Once a vaccine advocate, the Florida governor lost his enthusiasm for the shot before the Delta wave sent Covid hospitalizations and deaths soaring. It’s a grim chapter he now leaves out of his rosy retelling of his pandemic response.

title: For One Democrat, the Price of Bucking Her Party Is a Flood of Bad Reviews
description: Representative Marie Gluesenkamp Pérez’s automobile repair business has become a target of online trolls on the left after she opposed President Biden’s student loan forgiveness initiative.

title: Lawyers Say Helping Asylum Seekers in Border Custody Is Nearly Impossible
description: The Biden administration changed the way “credible fear” interviews are conducted and raised the bar for who is eligible to seek asylum.

title: Alabama Lawmakers Decline to Create New Majority-Black Congressional District
description: Republican lawmakers pushed through a new congressional map a month after the Supreme Court ruled that the state’s existing map diluted the power of Black voters.

title: How the Hunt for a Lioness Near Berlin Turned Into a Wild Boar Chase
description: The heavily armed search that upended the southern edge of the German capital met an anti-climactic end — and left some scratching their heads: “A wild boar doesn’t really look like a lion.”

title: The Question After Every Mass Shooting: How Much Do We Deserve to Know?
description: A court in Nashville may decide whether releasing the musings of a killer could help prevent future losses, despite adding to survivors’ pain.

title: Fact-Checking Mike Pence on the Campaign Trail
description: The former vice president has made misleading claims about abortion, fiscal policy and military spending.

title: Welcome to Barbenheimer Weekend
description: You have little choice but to surrender to the dark and the air conditioning and the allure of two of the summer’s biggest movies.

title: Tim Scott Is Turning Heads With Donors and Early-State Voters
description: The South Carolina senator is gaining in early-voting states and has money, a positive message and a compelling story. Now he needs to take on the Republican front-runners.

title: Biden Nominates Adm. Lisa Franchetti to Lead the Navy
description: If confirmed, Admiral Franchetti, who currently serves as the Navy’s second in command, would become the first woman to lead the service in its 247-year history.

title: Biden Elevates CIA Director William Burns to His Cabinet
description: William J. Burns, a veteran diplomat, has played a key role in the Biden administration’s efforts to thwart the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

title: DeSantis Tells Russell Brand That Jan. 6 ‘Was Not an Insurrection’
description: The main Republican rival to Donald J. Trump avoided answering whether he would pardon the former president.

title: JFK’s Grandson on Robert Kennedy’s Campaign: ‘An Embarrassment’
description: Jack Schlossberg, the grandson of John F. Kennedy, accused his older cousin of “trading in on Camelot” and spreading conspiracy theories “for personal gain and fame.”

title: A.I. Regulation Is in Its ‘Early Days’
description: While there has been a flurry of activity by the White House and lawmakers over artificial intelligence, rules for the technology remain distant, lawmakers and experts said.

title: Biden Picks Paul Friedrichs to Lead New White House Pandemic Office
description: Dr. Paul Friedrichs, a military combat surgeon and retired Air Force general, will lead the new office, which was created by Congress.

title: Trump Classified Documents Trial Set for May 2024
description: Judge Aileen M. Cannon rejected former President Donald J. Trump’s request to delay the trial until after the election but pushed the start date past the Justice Department’s request to begin in December.

title: Meta, Google and A.I. Firms Agree to Safety Measures in Biden Meeting
description: Amazon, Google and Meta are among the companies that announced the guidelines as they race to outdo each other with versions of artificial intelligence.

title: Sodomy Laws Remain in 12 States After Lawrence v. Texas
description: After Roe v. Wade was overturned last year, some feared that other court rulings, including the 2003 decision that invalidated sodomy laws, could be revisited. Maryland and Minnesota recently repealed theirs.

title: Big Business Gets Bigger
description: The U.S. government is struggling to crack down on corporate concentration.

title: Lawmakers Challenge Ford and Chinese Battery Partner Over Forced Labor
description: Republicans are raising fresh concerns about CATL, the battery maker Ford is working with to bring new technology to the U.S., and its connections to Xinjiang.

title: DeSantis doubles down on claim that some Blacks benefited from slavery
description: GOP presidential candidate says the controversial new Florida curriculum has ‘the most robust standards in African American history.’

title: Troopers detained a Black man. He exposed their unconstitutional conduct.
description: The Kansas Highway Patrol was waging "a war on motorists" and infringing their constitutional rights, a federal judge said this week.

title: Alabama legislature adopts new congressional map that could defy court order
description: The Republican-approved plan is expected to face a legal challenge.

title: DeSantis postures on Bud Light — wielding heavy hand of government again
description: Experts say the effort doesn’t appear to be serious. But it says a lot about the GOP.

title: Trump’s trial date conjures GOP’s nightmare scenario
description: Trump’s trial schedule is okay for Trump. It’s much worse for the GOP.

title: As Republicans elevate Robert F. Kennedy Jr., his polls sour
description: Kennedy's low ceiling has been evident; now, it's registering in the polls.

title: Utah Gov. Spencer Cox wants Americans to learn to ‘disagree better’
description: As chair of the National Governors Association, Cox wants to end the toxic partisanship that impedes real results.

title: Inside Biden’s unusual hidden campaign
description: Biden gambles that using Democratic and outside groups will work better than a big centralized campaign

title: AOC on her return to Twitch and the politics of gaming
description: Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez will play "Pico Park" on Twitch three years after her massively popular "Among Us" stream.

title: Fox News hosts are pushing Trump to join the Fox News GOP debate
description: Donald Trump's refusal to commit to the first debate of the 2024 cycle could make it a ratings wash-out. Aides say he’s unlikely to change his mind.

title: Before Jan. 6, Mark Meadows joked about Trump’s election claims
description: In a late 2020 text message that has been obtained by federal prosecutors, Meadows wrote that his son, Atlanta-area lawyer Blake Meadows, had been probing possible fraud and had found only a handful of possible votes cast in dead voters names, far short of what Trump was alleging.

title: After 20 years as Senate chaplain, Barry Black still speaks ‘truth to power’
description: The Rev. Barry Black has spent 20 years as chaplain, working under two Democratic Senate majority leaders and two Republican leaders. Ministering to future presidents, vice presidents and more.

title: Harris, on DeSantis’s turf, blasts Florida curriculum on Black history
description: Vice President Harris, in Florida, denounced what she calls an effort to rewrite the history of Black people in America.

title: Judge rejects jail for Oath Keepers’ Jan. 6 ‘operations coordinator’
description: Michael Greene said he was a paid security contractor, not a follower of Stewart Rhodes, when he went to the Capitol grounds and called others there who guarded Roger Stone.

title: The latest on Donald Trump’s indictments and other key investigations
description: What to know about Donald Trump's indictments in Miami and New York, and other investigations of the former president.

title: Kemp, Ga. governor, contacted by Trump special counsel in 2020 probe
description: Special counsel Jack Smith recently asked Gov. Brian Kemp (R) for information about efforts to overturn the election results in Georgia, the governor’s spokesman said.

title: Jets and other travel costs drain DeSantis campaign funds amid layoffs
description: The Florida governor’s campaign has spent more on travel than most of his Republican rivals.

title: All the times Trump’s trial conflicts with the 2024 election campaign
description: Trump is facing four pending civil and criminal cases already on the calendar — and more could be on the way.

title: DeSantis postures on Bud Light — wielding heavy hand of government again
description: Experts say the effort doesn’t appear to be serious. But it says a lot about the GOP.

title: Hunter Biden lawyer files complaint on Rep. Greene’s use of nude photos
description: The congresswoman showed nude photos of the president's son at a hearing this week. His attorney filed a complaint with the Office of Congressional Ethics.

title: Judge Cannon schedules Trump’s classified documents trial for May 2024
description: Trump's attorneys had asked to delay the high-stakes trial over the former president's alleged mishandling of classified documents until after the 2024 election.

title: Trump’s trial date conjures GOP’s nightmare scenario
description: Trump’s trial schedule is okay for Trump. It’s much worse for the GOP.

title: Judge rebukes Tucker Carlson, ‘QAnon Shaman’ for ‘alarming’ Jan. 6 spin
description: A judge has rejected Jacob Chansley’s bid to withdraw his guilty plea of obstructing Congress in the Jan. 6 Capitol attack and said his reliance on Tucker Carlson’s show about Jan. 6 was disappointing.
